text.section: Subject to the provisions of this section, the Board may waive the written part of the master barber or barber examination for an individual who is licensed to practice barbering in a foreign country.

Subject to subsection (c) of this section, the Board may grant a waiver under this section only if the applicant:
pays the examination fee required under § 4-303 of this subtitle that is attributable to the practical part of the examination;
passes the practical part of the master barber or barber examination given by the Board; and
provides adequate evidence that, at the time the applicant was licensed in the foreign country, the applicant was required to pass an examination and meet qualifications that were substantially equivalent to those then required by the laws of this State.

To meet a minimum standard of training, the Board may require an applicant licensed to practice barbering in a foreign country to complete successfully a required program of training in the practice of barbering not exceeding 1,200 hours.
